other_tests.findings: Changes compatible with EDS Type IV, with findings of fragmented elastic fibers and disarrangement of collagen. The small arteries exhibited disruption of internal elastic membranes.
Left carotid artery angiography revealed a dissecting aneurysm with severe stenosis located in the common carotid artery.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up angiography 1 month after the event revealed aggravation of the dissecting aneurysm, with severe stenosis of the left common carotid artery of more than 90%.

other_tests.findings: Demonstrated a decrease in cerebral blood flow beyond the infarction, indicating a high risk of reinfarction.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A 123I-IMP SPECT study performed 9 days post-treatment demonstrated an improvement in cerebral blood flow in the left temporal lobe.

other_tests.findings: Demonstrated good blood flow with no stenosis of the artery, and the aneurysm had disappeared.
Demonstrated artifacts at the proximal and distal ends of the stent in the left common carotid artery.
Demonstrated good blood flow through the left common carotid artery, with no dissecting aneurysm.
